page.title: 08Recreation Around Braydon
page.content: The fields and woods around Braydon provide ample opportunities for recreation. For walkers and riders on horseback there is a good network of footpaths and bridleways. There is also a quiet cycleway. The local youth groups enjoy camping holidays dureing the summer months. The local woods provide fuel for the fires. Fox-hunting and other blood sports are the recreations pursued in the country areas. There is no problem of limited space in this area and the houses generally have large gardens. Gardening is therefore a popular recreation. Many households are self-sufficient in vegetables. The main vegetables grown are root crops, beans, salad crops and onions.
